reviews.sentence: Customer service was great. People were all very nice and helpful. Really liked the rooms. Wanted more childrens channels on TV some in English for my kid.

Pleasant stay with really good breakfast buffet. I have also left some money in the hotel safe and the staff has kindly safeguarded it and listed out all the items in an email in a swift manner. Really appreciate the support by the staff.
Impressive. Staff and services were amazing and helpful location was excellent closed to the village and very safe. Nothing.

I stayed 2 different times in July 2015. Both times were excellent with the customer service at the front desk being very good and extremely helpful in assisting me in booking excursions in the Paris area. Breakfast was also very good and the staff at Breakfast were very professional. The room was excellent as well. Overall I would definitely recommend your hotel.

The Pullman Bercy in Paris. The front desk and bellmen rendered great and excellent service. They were very friendly when the French are noted the world over that they are not. They helped us at every opportunity when we needed confirmation with our bookings knowing fully well that our knowledge of the French language was limited to very few phrases. My husband and I were very impressed because they volunteered and offered for us before we even requested their assistance. It is too bad that we did not get all the names of those who made our stay very pleasant and memorable but we do recall Josephine who checked us in she helped us in finding the Metro which was a 5minute walk from the hotel Alesio and the bellman who assisted us a lot of times during our stay. I should also mention the folks who manned the bar they willingly gave us some ice when we asked for some. Our breakfast lady also willingly accommodated our request for fried eggs. And to our housekeeper lady thanks. Their staff consists of sincere helpful persons. Congratulations to the management for their right choice of peole. I would certainly recommend your property to our friends here in America and in the Phils. My husband works for the Mariot Hotels in the San Francsico area so we know what great service is like. One thing though. the bed was lumpy but counting the service we will overlook this. Thank you Pullman Bercy Staff. SERVICE COMPETENT SERVICE FRIENDLY SERVICE. The location is just perfect for tourists like us very proximate to the Metro and lots of restaurants around but no Italian or Chinese to choose. My only complaint is that their bed is lumpy that coming to rest at the end of a tiring tour day we would like something more comfortable.

Awesome. Staffs are very friendly and helpful especially Simon the front desk attendant who helped us contacting our service transfer and helped us with getting a taxi. Breakfast food was great and the hotel rooms are awesome.
I felt at home both myself and my wife. Food was excellent the staff was fantastic very friendly makes you feel welcome at all time very helpful keep up the good work.
Quiet clean very helpful staff. They speak good English. I like the fresh fruit at the front desk.

It was great staying at the Pullman Bercy. The staff is always available and provide an outstanding service. it was our first time there and we will definitely come back. Thank you to the whole staff. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. You made our stay in Paris a wonderful experience CHeers Cedric.

All you need very personable staff metro adjacent. This is set up for business but would be an excellent base to see Paris from provided you are Ok using the Metro. Traffic on the road in Paris was very slow its of road works. Modern hotel quiet corner room with views of the Seine. Small bistros within a block with range of food and wine.

Equally good and bad. The worst aspect of the trip was out check in. Our rooms were not ready and we had to wait for two hours in the hotel bar with a small child and one drink coupon per adult. This was extremely irritating after a long trip and the reception staff was only mildly apologetic. The rest of the stay was decent with helpful staff and mediocre food served at breakfast.

No pool all under refurbishment. I would not return while this place is under redevelopment. Lift queues are bad slow. Front desk is easily overwhelmed during check in and out. Breakfast buffet fruit was past its best and the yogurt consume by date was the May 8th and we were there on the 13th. On the good side location is okay and close to metro and a nice strip of restaurants cinema and shops. Close to gare de Lyon. Beds are small. Gym has weights to 10 kg 150 rep sets anyone. Nice staff commendable effort in tough circumstances.

Nice Area. The hotel was great. A bit modern and it seemed like some areas we under construction. But the staff was helpful and professional. Also it ’s a block or so away from a really cool night life area. A bunch of restaurants and bars that were clearly recently redone. Plus the vibe was hip with refurbished old buildings and nice ambient lighting. A bit far from typical Paris sights but it was great for business.

Terrible service and acomdations. The hotel is was under renovation while we were there despite no mention of such on their website or reservation confirmation. Drilling cutting and large construction machinery was in and out of the hotel all morning and night. The hotel staff acknowledged that the beautiful pictures on their website was of an imaginary hotel and lobby currently nonexistent. Our hotel room was dusty the entire week we were there despite housecleaning. The staff members were rude and not helpful.

Great Facility for a Family of Four. We stayed at the Pullman Bercy for five nights in one of their Duplex Suite with King Size Bed. It was a lovely 2 floor suite with a loft featuring the king size bed. We had a pull out sofa on the main floor and the hotel was kind enough to bring in a cot bed. The room included a half bath on the main floor and a full bath with shower on the loft floor. A mini refrigerator was also in the room although it did not keep drinks very cold. The room was very warm probably because one whole wall of the room is a 2story window. The views were beautiful but to keep the room reasonably cool we kept the curtains closed. Even still we called for service to the room the first night as it was not cooling down. Reception sent someone up right away he made some adjustments which helped with the room temp. The following night I requested a fan which was brought up to the room right away helped keep things cool for the rest of the stay. Our son used room service a number of times as he was not feeling well enough to venture out with us. He was very pleased with the service food. As mentioned in another recent review the hotel is undergoing renovations but we had no problems with this during our stayit is in a great location with the Village of Bercy just outside the hotels doors. Convenient Metro station cute shops lots of choices for meals. Breakfast was included in our stay but was not anything exciting. Our only complaint during our stay was the odor pumped into the elevator lobby the smell was constant and strong of mens cologne. We noticed it was coming from some sort of plugged in diffuser. Not sure the reasoning behind having it but we were not appreciative of it. In all the Pullman Bercy was a wonderful place to stay.

Deceptive experience in this hotel. The staff was deceptive. Me and my partner needed to wait for long to check in. And we heard they talked in french there were no rooms available. They might think we do not undertand french but we did speak french. The staff exchanged few words and returned to us and they pretended to give us an upgrade since there were no available standard room. And guess what we got. They gave us without any explanation a room for people with disability with no bathtub. I stayed at this hotel couple of times so I know even standard rooms have bathtubs. I doubt that if we were Frenches not Asians they would have given us that room as well.

Translated by Google. The hotel room was not ok fresh air was not necessary. The breakfast buffet was ok. The staff was ok but as in other hotels in this class no one was willing to talk in German they spoke Russian English. SpanishOriginalDas Hotelzimer war nicht ok Frischluft war nicht nötig. Das Frühstückbufet war ok. Das Personal war ok aber wie auch schon in anderen Hotels dieser Klase war niemand bereit sich auf Deutsch zu unterhslten dafür sprachen sie rusisch engl spanisch.

Translated by Google. We stayed many times but room was large widely and was comfortable. It is also possible to hold a meeting. The hotel reception is available in English. It is near from subway station. As shopping mall is near it is convenient for dinerOriginal何度も宿泊しましたが、部屋も広く快適でした。会議の開催も可能です。ホテルのフロントは英語対応が可能です。地下鉄の駅からも近いです。ショッピングモールが近くにあるので、夕食にも便利です 。.

Absolutely thrilled with our stay at your hotel. The hotel interior looked so glamorous. All the staff we met were extremely friendly and helpful to us. The breakfast had a fantastic selection and the staff in the mornings were great especially Joseph who always had a smile and a friendly chat we appreciated that. The housekeeping staff also did an amazing job. We felt very spoilt and were extremely happy to spend our Christmas at your hotel.
Good. Le profesionalisme du personnel. La caution de 90 € demandée au Check in au cas ou. en attendant le Check out.

Worst staff in a long time. Room was ok hotel in general looks ok but the staff deleted all that and more. rude unhelpful and ignorant. goes out of their way to ignore you and make you feel like an idiot standing there. obviously whoever is in charge of restaurant bar staff should be replaced with someone that can train staff and let them know their guests pay lots of money to stay there and should be treated accordingly impossible to get a drink reckon I could stay there all day and no one would talk to me. at the second go the bar staff in middle sentence taking order turned around and had a shot and celebrated with other staff. Need I go on there was some kind of a arty farty do on taking up the entire bar and their little coupons were very important whilst totally ignoring paying guests. At breakfast tried for about 20 minutes to get coffee. but no not posibleone that is 1 womanslowest in history walking slowly and chats away with staff goes around takes order from one table then goes back herself and makes the couple of coffees and delivers them herself. can I remind you this is a BIG hotel lots of people waiting for coffee I ’l tell ya. and breakfast was rubbish overall anyway not just saying that because I ’m disappointed was just not very good food fresh french bread yum. not here I ’m afraid. so yes goes without saying not going back to Pullman Bercy ever.

The hotel is super well located a few steps away from a small shopping village with a variety of shops restaurants a cinema and even a small supermarket. The metro station is right behind that shopping mall so it isa walk of about 5 minutes from the hotel which is super convenient. The hotel staff is very helpful and the hotel is modern has various amenities like a bar with coffee service restaurant spa pool and even has a few items for sale among others. I did not use most of the amenities but I saw the facilities and they are super nice. The housekeeping service is good but not super a few things on the floor remained there for the duration of our stay. Beds are super comfortable the curtains do a great job of keeping the light out and one can not hear anything from adjacent rooms or the outside. My only issue was with the A C which during the nights seemed to loose some power as the bedroom became a bit warm but during the day it was just fine and that there is not much storage space in the room so we had to live out of the luggage for the duration of the week. We had a very pleasant stay and liked the area very much.

two nigths trip to Paris. Main reason for our stay was to watch a show in the nearby Acor Arena … I write this article as a Platinum member. Arrival into Paris with our private car was fine. Parking at the hotel is very difficult even just for check in. Only two check in counters were available with a view people waiting. When it was my turn I presented my booking details as well as my platinum membership card. No greetings as a loyal member was given as well as no upgrade. Even for the welcome drink vouchers I had to ask at the end of check in. So the check in experiences compared with other Pullman hotels was not so good. Our room was a family room with two big beds. Nice and clean perfect for our stay. I made my self a cup of tea before we left for the show. After we came back we discovered that the water kettle was spoilt and water was leaking all over the area. Spilling water on some of my documents and my mobile phone luckily the phone was still working. The kettle was exchanged after we complained to the front desk but when we returned to the room after dinner the next problem happened. Our room was without power. So I had to go back to the front desk to ask for help again. We had to wait for 15 minutes till somebody came up to the room just to check on some fuses which caused the problem with the power fail. Next morning we went for breakfast around 0930 hopping to avoid the big Chinese ’s travel groups but unfortunately they were still there. So we had to wait for a table and it was very load. Once we had a table we discovered that a lot of breakfast stuff was not available. For example the complete tea section was out of stock glasses were missing at the juice section and lots of food was not available. So the breakfast experience was not very pleasant and we were looking forward to it because we read that Pullman has one of the best breakfasts in town. After my breakfast I wanted to collect my tickets for a river cruise on the Sein which I was included in my room package. Unfortunately the tickets were not ready yet and I was ask to wait another 30 minutes before the responsible person would arrive. Of course I do n’t wanted to wait again so we left without the tickets and bought them latter on directly at the cruise company. At check out we were reimbursed for the tickets and the room rate was reduced as well for one night to compensate the price different. This was nice of the hotel but still I ca n’t believe a 4 star hotel ca n’t even handle a sim.

Nice hotel and friendly staff but the Pool was out of action which was my main reason for choosing hotel. Very nice hotel is a nice location beside Bercy Village. I stay in a different hotel in Bercy every week and I was starting to like this one. On this occasion however the pool which is the main draw for me was out of action due to an incident. This was poorly communicated and staff did not seem to know how to handle the situation. Also I do not believe that my Platinum status was acknowledged with an upgrade despite the hotel being fairly empty.

Enjoyable experience at hotel. Enjoyed staying at the hotel. Staff were very professional friendly and helpful check in check out bar where we had breakfast taxi bokingFacilities were very good as was the location close to Bercy vilageDécor of the hotel was pleasing to the eye. However would have been useful to know the opening and closing hours of the restaurant had to wait for a member of staff to tell us whether or not this was either open or closedAlso would have been useful for a door on the actual shower cubicle.

Great Staff. The staff was amazing. From check in to problem solving to check out every staff member was superb. The room had some issues. The phone would not connect to housekeeping needed extra towels or room service for dinner. The window latch was broken. When brought to the attention of staff every item was addressed immediately.

MODERN 5 STAR. Staff were excellent. Room junior suite modern clean and spacious. Only quibble …. we were told there would be a bath and there was only a shower. Free soft drinks in room. Breakfast orders VERY slow …. although i believe this was the fault of the SYSTEM and NOT the staff. 20 minutes to get a fried egg. If you ARE going to have a buffet breakfast system then you should include drinks. It is RIDICULOUS to have staff going backwards and forwards for just tea or coffee. In fact watching the staff they themselves got the drinks from a machine. This could so easily have been put out in the room freeing up the staff to get orders such as eggs. Hotel good in all other regards. Close to Metro and also convenient for Bercy Village if you did not want to go far at night.
